intro: Pavetta pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. Pavetta pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
